intro: Lycoctonum shansiense, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, oval fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens despite its limited distribution in the wild.
